snippet: With China pressing territorial claims and the United States fortifying its alliances in the region, a day of military talks will precede wider-ranging discussions this week.
lead_paragraph: BEIJING -- Limited military talks between China and the United States -- an arena in which the two sides view each other with mounting unease -- open here on Wednesday as a prelude to a wider-ranging economic and strategic dialogue between Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton and Treasury Secretary Timothy F. Geithner and their Chinese counterparts. China is increasingly suspicious of what it views as stepped-up spying by American planes and ships along its coast, and the United States is disquieted by China's growing array of weaponry, analysts on both sides say.

headline.main: U.S.-China Military Talks to Open Amid Unease
